item.title: How to Globally Gitignore Configuration Files
item.description: Until today, I did not make up my mind about what to do with configuration files, created by e.g. VS Code. Certainly, I do not want to commit them, but putting it into every’s repository .gitignore file is also cumbersome - and sometimes it is not possible. I always do a git add -u to avoid accidentally adding a venv or similar, so it did not really matter. Except… ❯ .

item.title: How to Avoid Vscode From Causing High Cpu Load When You Have Directories With Many Files
item.description: Once I opened this one project, CPU load went through the roof and just did not stop. There is not much source code in the repository, but a lot of build artifacts get generated by it. I am using VS Code now for quite a while, and especially for this one repository, and I never noticed problems, until recently. As most of the time extensions are the cause for problems, the VS Code team even provides a kind of bisecting mechanism to help find faulty plugins.

item.title: How to Deactivate Auto Import in Pylance
item.description: Unfortunately, the auto-import feature in PyLance surprised me with random imports. e.g. with from unittest.case import expectedFailure just when I typed assert result == expected. Luckily, the developers heard on the users, and with version 2020.8.0 this “feature” is optional. In order to deactivate it, set the following option to false: python.analysis.autoImportCompletions Thank you, Savannah!
